result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Gerdmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Schedule IV Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(i).
  • Falsely Present Noncontrolled Substance [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(4)(am)1a.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs on each count.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
To reimburse Door/Kewaunee Drug Task Force for buy money.
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.   Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Maintain full-time employment and/or schooling as directed by probation agent.

timeConds.notes: Jail time applies to Ct. 1. 90 days stayed - to be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. Huber release granted 10 days to report.

To perform 100 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.
4/24/17 - Court converts remaining community service to a $300 fine.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for early discharge from probation pursuant to 973.09(3)(d)
from DOC Agent Olivia Glesner with request for early discharge from probation for defendant.
from DOC Agent Olivia Glesner indicating defendnt would be willing to pay instead pay an amount to the court in lieu of his community service hours.
94.7 hours of community service converted to be money owed. ($300)

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1, 2 & 3.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1, 2 & 3. Court dismisses Cts. 4 & 5 but reads in for sentencing purposes. Court reviews collateral consequences, possible penalties for felony conviction with defendant. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin. State/Defense ready to proceed with sentencing without the benefit of a PSI.  Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Joshua J Gerdmann in court with attorney Tina Van Dyn Hoven.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Defense waives reading of the Information.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 15, 2014 at 10:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 23, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua J Gerdmann in court.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case at 2:30 PM. Atty Walsh had called Atty Korb saying he was running late. Court has another matter scheduled for 2:30 PM today that will take the rest of the afternoon, won't have time to take plea today. Court keeps 5/23/14 hearing on the calendar for a plea hearing. Bond remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
from Atty Walsh advising matter has been resolved, asks court to set a plea/sentencing date. Court sets hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 1, 2014 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Joshua J Gerdmann in court with attorney Adam Walsh.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of the criminal complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Atty Walsh indicates defendant will probably be waiving the preliminary hearing when we get to that day. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.
from Atty Walsh's office requesting to reschedule 3/13/14 hearing because of a conflict. Court reschedules.

Defendant Joshua J Gerdmann in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defendant indicates he doesn't qualify for PD representation, requests time to retain an atty. Bond remains as is.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 13, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 2/18/14 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 5/15/14)

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Joshua J Gerdmann in court with attorney Carrie LaPlant.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty LaPlant indicates she's only representing defendant for bond hearing, different counsel will be appointed. State gives incident report, potential charges.  Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel.  Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 10:00 am.
